did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Rodolfo Echeverría Martínez Collection,
did.abstract: Reports, correspondence, minutes, conference proceedings, resolutions, speeches, pamphlets, discussion bulletins, newsletters, and printed matter, relating to activities of the Partido Comunista Mexicano from its formation in 1919 until its merger with other parties in 1981, including electoral, trade union, student and other activities, and activities both at the national level and within various states.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Rodolfo Echeverría Martínez collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1987.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Partido Comunista Mexicano (P.C.M.) was organized in September 1919 by Mexican socialists under the direction of Comintern representatives Manabendra Nath Roy and Michael Borodin. The political instability and radicalism of the final years of the Mexican Revolution, combined with a native tradition of anarcho-syndicalism and trade unionism, created a party with a large rural following, as well as strength among transport workers, miners, educators and intellectuals. The party probably reached maximum strength (approximately 30,000 members) during the Popular Front period, when it cooperated with the administration of President Lazaro Cardenas (1934-1940). By 1960, the membership was estimated at 3,000. In 1940, two important leaders, Hernan Laborde and Valentin Campa, expelled from the P.C.M. for "right opportunist deviation", formed the Partido Obrero-Campesino Mexicano (P.O.C.M.). In 1948, the Partido Popular Socialista (P.P.S.) was established by Vincente Lombardo Toledano. From its inception, the P.P.S. was more influential; its larger membership allowed its candidates to qualify for election registration, a goal which the P.C.M. was never able to achieve under the old electoral law.

After the 1968 protest movement and subsequent government repression, the P.C.M. abandoned attempts to cooperate with the the government party (Partido Revolucionario Institucional, P.R.I.) and organized to work for political rights and electoral reform. In the mid-1970's the P.C.M. formed electoral coalitions with other leftist groups; after 1978, electoral reform made it possible for the party to register legally and participate openly in elections. The political dominance of the P.R.I. disinclined the P.C.M. to concentrate on parliamentary activity, however. The greater focus was on creating a stronger mass-based party, leading to the unification of the P.C.M. with four other left-wing parties in 1981 to form the Partido Socialista Unificado de Mexico (P.S.U.M.).

Rodolfo Echeverría Martínez was a student activist in the late 1960's, and a member of the Executive Commission in the mid-1970's. Opposed to unification, he left the party in 1981. The material was assembled by Echeverria during and after his membership in the party, as well as from at least two other sources. Gabino R. Alcaraz was active in Michoacan in the 1920's and 1930's, initially as acting president of the Partido Socialista Michoacano (ca. 1925). By 1927, he was a member of the P.C.M. state Central Committee and responsible for agrarian affairs. His papers are organized as a separate series. Enrique Condes Lara was a member of the P.C.M. Central Committee in Puebla, and head of the electoral operation there; materials gathered by him are included in the section relating to the state of Puebla.

did.unittitle: PARTIDO COMUNISTA MEXICANO, CENTRAL COMMITTEE, 1921-1986.

odd.p: Reports, correspondence, agenda, minutes, flyers, miscellany, notes, meeting materials, speech transcripts, pamphlets, circulars, discussion bulletins, forms, lists, serial issues, budgets, interviews, newsletters, memoranda, charts, convocations, press releases, clippings, and resolutions. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: PARTIDO COMUNISTA MEXICANO, NATIONAL CONFERENCES, 1921-1982.

odd.p: Resolutions, reports, discussion bulletins, charts, circulars, pamphlets, statutes, press releases, outlines, notes, convocations, serial issues, speech transcripts, miscellany, and clippings. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: PARTIDO COMUNISTA MEXICANO, REGIONAL COMMITTEES, 1935-1981.

odd.p: Reports, letters, instructions, miscellany, circulars, newsletters, minutes, resolutions, pamphlets, statutes, notes, lists, speech transcripts, press releases, clippings, flyers, sample ballots, forms, agenda, and discussion bulletins. Arranged alphabetically by state.

did.unittitle: GABINO R. ALCARAZ PAPERS, 1925-1963.

scopecontent.p: Relates to P.C.M. activity in the State of Michoacan. Correspondence, forms, minutes, charts, circulars, miscellany, flyers, reports, newsletters, resolutions, and telegrams.

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1919-1983.

odd.p: Relates primarily to other Mexican political organizations and parties. Newsletters, pamphlets, forms, circulars, flyers, pamphlets, instructions, bulletins, reports, leaflets, serial issues, and clippings. Arranged alphabetically by organizations.

did.unittitle: OVERSIZE FILE, 1911-1981.

odd.p: Newspapers, newsletters, circulars, declarations and election materials. Arranged to correspond with the previous series.

did.unittitle: PHONOTAPES, 1976.
PARTIDO COMUNISTA MEXICANO, CENTRAL COMMITTEE, 1921-1986
General
General
General, ca. 1928-1964. Song, miscellany, postcards, and a report relating to an information leak
Circulars. Relating to the Federacion Juvenil Comunista, conferences, assassinations of members, and domestic and international political affairs, ca. 1929-1976
Correspondence. Letters by J. Encarnacion Perez, Manuel Terrazas, Valentin Campa, Agustin Montiel, and others, some of which were written from prison, 1934-1971
Meeting materials. Primarily material relating to plenary sessions
General. Letters, agenda, minutes, flyers, and miscellany, 1975-1979
1934 Jan.-1935 Oct. Handwritten and mimeographed notes, a pamphlet and a printed article; primarily relates to the Frente Unico and international affairs, and plenary sessions of Jan. and Aug. 1934
1937 June and Dec. Printed report and resolutions from plenary session, relating to anti-fascist unity
1941 Dec. Minutes of Buro Politico meeting, relating to national unity and international affairs, and internal organization and direction
1942 Nov. Report relating to party organization and development
1949 Oct. Reports, resolutions and a pamphlet by Dionisio Encino and J. Encarnacion Valdez entitled, Por la Paz, la Democracia y la Independencia Nacional

1956 Dec. Two plenary session reports relating to party organization and internal conflict, including one by J. Encarnacion Perez, and a pamphlet entitled, La Lucha Interna en el Partido Durante los Anos de 1939 a 1948: Caracteristicas Principales
1958 Jan.-May. Plenary session reports, notes, a pamphlet, and a report by Dionisio Encina primarily relating to internal conflict and activity
1959 July-Aug. Pamphlets relating to internal struggles, railroad strikes, political prisoners and the XXI Soviet Party Congress
1960 July. Discussion materials for a plenary session, including reports presented by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo and Edelmiro Maldonado; includes material relating to Cuba
1961 July and Dec. Plenary session resolutions and a report by Edelmiro Maldonado relating to internal party conflict with the Federal District committee
1962. Handwritten notes from unidentified meetings, relating to an economic campaign
1963 Feb. Mimeographed communication from J. Encarnacion Perez (from jail) to the plenary meeting, relating to international communism and specific situations in Cuba, Yugoslavia, China and Italy
1965-1972. Handwritten notes relating to meetings on student problems
1969 May-1973 May. Collection of handwritten notes covering numerous meetings during this period, primarily plenary and presidium sessions
1973 June and 1975 July. Memorandum and report to plenary session relating to party activities and goals
1976 April and Aug. Press release and reports, including two by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo, relating to party growth and development and political reform
1977 Feb. Reports by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo, list of agreements and miscellany
1977 March. Report by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo entitled "El PCM Ante el Problema de la Unidad de Partidos Socialistas"
1977 (ca. May-June?). Report and resolutions relating to the party program and internal organization
1977 Sept.-1978 Feb. Primarily a collection of handwritten notes for multiple meetings (Executive Commission?), including a plenary session, 1977 Sept.
1978 Feb. Report by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo
1978 Sept. Reports by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo and Arturo Martinez Nateras
1979 May. Report

1979 August. Resolutions and reports relating to planned party activities, primarily electoral activity; includes Gilberto Enriquez Garcia, "Direcciones Principales del Trabajo de Construccion del Partido" and "Nuestra Presencia Electoral y las Nuevas Tareas en la Lucha por la Democracia"
1980 Feb. Discussion materials and a report by Gilberto Rincon Gallardo, "Las Comunistas en la Camara"
1980 May. Convocation, proposed agenda for the Nineteenth National Congress, a report entitled "La Propaganda del P.C."
1980 Dec. Printed pamphlet relating to party political activities
1981 April. Form letter, list of Central Committee members, and reports, primarily on organization
1981 May. Form letter, miscellany and a proposed resolution
1981 June. Form letter, reports, circular, miscellany, calendar of preliminary meetings for the Twentieth National Congress; includes materials relating to Poland
1981 July. Telegram, form letter, reports, and membership statistics
1981 Aug. 1-3. Leaflet and reports relating to political reform and the second party electoral convention (proposed for 1981 Sept.)
1981 Aug. 25-26. Financial report and charts, telegram, list of Central Committee members and a report on unification
1981 Sept. Circulars and a declaration of principles
1981 Oct. Report by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo, "Nueva Etapa en la Lucha por el Partido de la Clase Obrera" and agreements relating to unification
Membership materials. Pamphlet, identification cards, applications, letters, miscellany, circular, forms and flyers; includes letters from Rodolfo Echeverría Martínez, 1931-1981
Publications
General. Reports on party publishing concerns, statistics, letters, flyer, pamphlets, and a list, 1954-1980
Boletin de Informacion. Newsletters, 1963 Aug.-Nov.
El Constructor. Newsletters, 1938 March-1944 April
El Machete. Typed copies of articles, circulars, letter, serial issues, and meeting minutes, 1924-1964. SEE: OVERSIZE FILE for additional serial issues
Machete. Serial issues, 1980 May-1981 July
Nuestras Tareas. Bulletins, 1974 Jan.-1978 April
Oposicion. Reports, budgets, circulars, flyers, schedules, lists and miscellany; includes materials relating to cultural festivals, 1975-1981. SEE: OVERSIZE FILE for newsletters
Socialismo. Serial issue, 1975
Teoria. Serial issues and a letter, 1947-1950
La Voz de Mexico. Copy of an article, circulars, financial materials, reports and a letter. SEE: OVERSIZE FILE for serial issues, 1943-1966
Speech transcripts. Printed copy of a speech by Dionisio Encina, a speech and a newspaper interview with Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo, 1943-1981
Statutes. Report with proposals and a pamphlet, 1981
Commissions and committees

Comision de Educacion, Agitacion y Propaganda (later Comision de Educacion y Propaganda). Letters, notes, description of function, educational materials, flyer, action plan and pamphlets, 1938-ca. 1979
Comision de Inspeccion y Disciplina (later Comision Central de Control). Letters, meeting reports, memorandum, and interrogations relating primarily to disciplinary actions, 1939-1978

Comision Nacional de Finanzas. Letters, plans, miscellany, receipts, budgets, flyers, circulars, charts, reports, a convocation and pamphlets; includes material relating to a national conference on finances and fund-raising campaigns, 1931-1980

Comision Nacional Juvenil. Action plans, speeches, resolutions, program, bulletins, newsletters (Joven Camarada), letters; includes material relating to the XI Festival Mundial de la Juventud y los Estudiantes and the Federacion Mundial de la Juventud Democratica, 1940-1978. SEE ALSO: Educational issues and youth organizations/Students/Juventud Comunista
Comision Nacional Sindical. Circulars, reports and resolutions relating to specific work conditions and general trade union programs, 1932-1979
Comision Politica. Letters, circulars, resolution, press release, report by Dionisio Encina, declarations and a flyer, 1948-1963
Agrarian issues. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE

General. Circular, statement, outline, reports by J. Encarnacion Perez and others, a pamphlet relating to sugar cane workers, meeting report and letters; includes a declaration on indigenous peoples, ca. 1931-1975
Central Campesina Independiente. Statutes and flyer, 1964-1965
Confederacion Nacional Campesina. Pamphlet, 1944
Liga Nacional Campesina. Circulars, proposed statutes, and a newsletter (Boletin de Bandera Roja, ) ca. 1931-1934)
Educational issues and youth organizations
General. Reports and pamphlets; includes materials relating to educational programs for party members and workers, 1935-1979. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE
Students

General. Reports, resolutions, newsletters, convocations, delegate identification form, and pamphlets, including material relating to the Central Nacional de Estudiantes Democraticos (CNED), 1935-1976
Juventud Comunista. Resolutions, reports, letter, circulars, newsletters and pamphlets; includes materials relating to the second and third national congresses, 1933-1979
Teachers and university workers
Frente Magisterial Nacional. Newsletter (Educador Socialista), 1978-1979
Movimiento Revolucionario del Magisterio (MRM). Flyers, pamphlets, reports, resolutions, discussion materials and a press release, 1959-1976
Sindicato Nacional de Trabajadores de la Educacion (SNTE). Resolutions, reports, declarations, pamphlets, flyer, letter and discussion materials for a national meeting, 1958-1981
Elections. SEE ALSO: REGIONAL COMMITTEES/Puebla (and other states) and OVERSIZE FILE
General. Flyers, pamphlets, reports, lists, discussion materials, action plans, notes and a circular, relating to registration, electoral reform and conventions, 1957-1981

1964. Plans, flyers, membership forms, list, position statements, letters, report, newsletter, speeches by Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo and Valentin Campa, agenda, instructions, pamphlets and circulars; includes materials relating to the Frente Electoral del Pueblo, 1963-1965
1976. Plans, flyers, pamphlets and circulars relating to the presidential campaign of Valentin Campa, 1975-1976
1979. Instructions, reports, convocation, plans, forms, and pamphlets; includes material relating to the Coalicion de la Izquierda, 1978-1979
1980. Report and flyer
Electrical workers. Newsletter, circular, letter, statutes and a flyer, 1949-1972
Health workers. Reports and an agenda, 1965-1977
History of the party. Outlines, reports, and chronologies, including a report by Enrique Condes Lara entitled "Los Ultimos Anos del Partido Comunista Mexicano", ca. 1956-1985
Internal organization, development and conflict
General
General. Pamphlets, outlines, letters, newletter, plans, reports, instructions and statutes, 1944-1980. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE
Leon Garza, Maximo de. "A Proposito de Algunas Concepciones del Grupo 'Espartaco'", 1966
Martinez Verdugo, Arnoldo. "Problemas Actuales del Desarollo del Partido," 1970
MacGregor Campuzano, Javier. "Crisis en una Organizacion Partidaria: El Partido Comunista Mexicano en la Decada de los Cuarenta," 1986
Political programs and goals
Pamphlets, 1959-1981
Reports. Includes drafts and printed copies of Declaracion Programatica del Partido
Trotskyism. Printed speech transcript by Hernan Laborde, a report by Jose Revueltas, and a pamphlet by Miguel Angel Velasco entitled La Lucha Contra el Trotskismo en los Anos 30, ca. 1938-1980
Unification. Flyers, declarations, press release, meeting minutes, and reports, 1977-1981. SEE ALSO: Twentieth Party Congress
International communism and international affairs
General. Newsletters, pamphlets, reports, flyer, trip reports, letter, speech transcript and a resolution, 1921-1979
Afghanistan. Pamphlet, meeting agenda, reports and printed articles, 1980
Cuba. Pamphlets, newsletters, instructions, circulars, declarations and flyers, ca. 1926-1976
Latin America
General. Pamphlets, declarations, reports, flyers and Central American newsletters, 1942-1984

Conferencia Latinoamericana por la Soberania Nacional, la Emancipacion Economica y la Paz. Flyers, pamphlets, speech transcript by Lazaro Cardenas, circulars, and declarations, 1961. SEE: OVERSIZE FILE for newsletters

Soviet Union. Declarations, serial issue and reports, including U.R.S.S. Anuario para 1927, Rafael Ramos Pedrueza, La Estrella Roja: Doce Anos de Vida Sovietica, General Alberto Zuno Hernandez, El Ejercito y el Pueblo Sovieticos Vistos por un General Mexicano, and Hernan Laborde, La Biologica en la U.R.S.S.: Revolucion en la Genetica, 1927-1966
Trade union movement and syndicalism
General. Serial issue and pamphlets; includes material relating to the Fifth and Eighth World Syndical Congresses, 1961-1977
Boletin de la Internacional Sindical Roja, Secretariado Internacional de la Confederacion General del Trabajo Unitaria de Francia (C.G.T.U.)
Boletin Sindical, Consejo Central de los Sindicatos de la U.R.S.S., Comision de Relaciones Exteriores, 1929 Jan.-July
United States. Convocation for the sixteenth convention of the Communist Party, U.S.A., a press release and reports on migrant workers and other subjects, ca. 1929-1979

World War II and the Popular Front. Pamphlets by Dionisio Encina and others, transcription of a speech by Josef Stalin, a speech by Dionisio Encina, a newsletter, miscellany, pamphlets, instructions, discussion report, miscellany, and a manifesto by the Communist Party of the U.S.A., 1931-1942. SEE ALSO: NATIONAL CONFERENCES/1940 Extraordinary Congress
Mexican economics. Press release, pamphlets, outline, declarations and reports, 1945-1979. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE
Mexican politics and government. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE

General. Circulars, pamphlets, press releases and reports, and an interview between the P.C.M. and President Jose Lopez Portillo; includes presidential statements and commentaries, and an open letter to Emilio Portes Gil, 1935-1978

Political prisoners and government repression. Circulars, pamphlets, meeting materials, lists, letters (including some from imprisoned leaders), flyers, declarations, press releases, resolutions, newsletter and pamphlets. Includes material relating to the Comite por la Libertad de los Presos Politicos y Defensa de las Garantias Constitucionales, and the arrest of David A. Siqueiros, including an inscribed copy of La Tracala: Mi Replica a un Gobierno Fiscal-Juez, 1959-1981
Political reform. Reports, clipping and press releases, 1976-1980
Miners and metallurgical workers. Pamphlet, letter, proposal, report, discussion materials, and newsletter, 1928-1981
Petroleum workers. Reports, leaflet and material for a national meeting, ca. 1946-1977
Railway workers. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE

General. Pamphlets, newsletter, reports by Hernan Laborde and others, circulars, flyers, speech transcript and letters (Valentin Campa and Arnoldo Martinez Verdugo); includes materials relating to the Oposicion Sindical Revolucionaria Ferrocarrilera (OSRF), the Consejo Nacional Ferrocarrilero and the Sindicato de Trabajadores Ferrocarrileros, 1936-1980
1959 strike. Flyers, pamphlets, newsletters, resolutions, reports by Jose Revueltas and others, and a booklet by Elias Barrios entitled, El Escuadron de Hierro, 1958-1959
Religion. Pamphlet, flyer, song and report, ca. 1928-1977
Trade union movement and syndicalism. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE
General

General. Clippings, reports, pamphlets, flyer, circular, directory of trade unions, resolutions, and newsletters; relates to miscellaneous strikes and working conditions, and meetings, including national syndical conferences, 1931-1980
Conferencia Nacional Sindical, 1978 Dec. Discussion bulletins, reports, letters, resolutions, rules, miscellany, declaration and pamphlets, 1978

Comite de Defensa Proletaria. Circulars, letter, newsletter; includes material relating to the death of Julio A. Mella and a regional meeting, 1928-1929

General. Circulars, reports, letters, flyers, press releases, action plans, agenda, charts, resolutions, and pamphlets relating to organization, university elections and reform, trade unions and strikes

Sinaloa. Internal bulletins, newsletters, action plans, position papers, discussion bulletins, pamphlets, resolutions, and reports; includes materials relating to party organization, regional meetings, elections and the Universidad Autonoma de Sinaloa, 1971-1981. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE
Sonora. Status reports, membership list (?), 1961-197?
Tabasco. Program announcements, reports, action plans, circular, newsletter, and resolutions relating to party organization, regional meetings, and the Mexican economy, 1962-1977

General
General

1971-1976. Circulars, action plans, reports, flyers and letters; includes material relating to the Comision Sindical Regional, regional meetings, electoral campaigns, internal organization, the press and propaganda
1977-1978. Reports, pamphlets, action plans, letters, resolutions, calendar, list and circulars; includes materials relating to a regional conference

1979-1981. Position papers, reports, letter, and information bulletins; includes material relating to political reform, party organization and development, the 1979 election campaign, and the student movement

General. Pamphlets, newsletters, action plans, circulars, reports, bulletins, resolutions, letters, and discussion materials relating to meetings, 1969-1981
Newsletter (Combate), 1972-1974

Yucatan. Newsletter, plans, newsletters, discussion materials, circulars, and reports; includes materials relating to organization, elections, and regional meetings, 1972-1977
Zacatecas. Resolutions, pamphlet, and resolutions, 1968-1977
GABINO R. ALCARAZ PAPERS, 1925-1963

1925. NOTE: Papers of Gabino R. Alcaraz, Acting President of the Partido Socialista Michoacano. Letters, form, meeting minutes, and a declaration of principles; relates primarily to membership and local agrarian affairs
1927-1930. Correspondence with the Central Committee and others, financial chart, miscellany, circulars; relates to agrarian issues, the Bloque Obrero y Campesino, and government repression

1931-1932. Correspondence with the Central Committee and others, circulars and miscellany; relates to administrative affairs, agrarian issues, meetings, the Bloque Obrero y Campesino, and the Confederacion Revolucionaria Michoacana del Trabajo

1933. Correspondence with the Central Committee and others, flyer, programs, status reports from cells, circulars and a newsletter; relates to the Bloque Obrero y Campesino and municipal elections, international affairs (primarily Europe and Cuba), agrarian and trade union organizations and activities

1934. Correspondence with the Central Committee and others, circulars, form, newsletter, and a convocation; relates to administrative affairs, the Bloque Obrero y Campesino and elections, international affairs, agrarian and trade union activities

1935. Circulars, correspondence with the Central Committee and others, reports to the Central Committee, short reports prepared for submission to El Machete, resolutions, newsletter and miscellany. Relates to agrarian organizations, agricultural and trade union strikes, Cuba, the circulation of El Machete, municipal elections and the Bloque Obrero y Campesino, and other subjects

1936. Correspondence with the Central Committee, El Machete, and others, telegrams, circular, proposal, reports to the Central Committee and miscellany; relates primarily to internal conflict in agrarian organizations
1937. Letters, resolution, telegrams; relates primarily to local elections and meetings
1956-1963. Letters, memoranda, meeting report, bulletin, and a flyer; relates to internal conflict and meetings
SUBJECT FILE, 1919-1983.

odd.p: Primarily relates to political organizations and parties other than the PCM

Movimiento de Liberacion Nacional. Newsletter (El Despertador Obrero), 1964
Partido Obrero Campesino Mexicano (P.O.C.M.). Flyers, pamphlets, bulletins, declarations, circulars, report, and newsletters, 1951-1960
Partido Popular Socialista (P.P.S.)
General. Letter, declaration, leaflet, flyer, serial issues and pamphlets by Vincente Lombardo Toledano and others, 1957-ca. 1976
Nueva Democracia. Serial issues, 1967-1970

Socorro Rojo. Organizational plan (fragment), and circulars, 1929-1937
OVERSIZE FILE, 1911-1981

Newsletters, manifestos, flyers, declarations, election materials and clippings relating to internal affairs, education, trade unions, elections, international affairs, Mexican politics, railroad unions, and regional organizations. Corresponds to the PARTIDO COMUNISTA MEXICANO, CENTRAL COMMITTEE series and the PARTIDO COMUNISTA MEXICANO, REGIONAL COMMITTEES series.

Newsletters, circulars, and newspapers, relating to the Mexican revolution, the PCM Central Committee, agrarian issues, Mexican politics, international affairs, and trade unions. Some of this material corresponds to the SUBJECT FILE series; the original oversize copies of other materials (which have been photocopied and placed in the collection), are also included.
PHONOTAPES
One reel labelled "Campa, 20 mujeres y 1 hombre," 1976 June 18
